meanings.definition: To crush or flatten with a steamroller.
meanings.sent1: The workers were steamrolling the new road to make it smooth.
meanings.sent2: The steamroller was used to steamroll the fresh asphalt on the street.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally steamrolled my sandwich in my bag, now it's completely flat!
meanings.sent4: Her powerful voice steamrolled through the noise of the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The steamrolling machine pressed down on the ground with incredible force.

meanings.sent1: The team steamrolled their opponents in the championship game.
meanings.sent2: The dictator tried to steamroll any opposition to his rule.
meanings.sent3: The cat steamrolled over the toy mouse, claiming victory in the game.
meanings.sent4: His charisma steamrolled over any doubts the audience had about his speech.
meanings.sent5: The giant wave steamrolled everything in its path, leaving nothing standing.

meanings.sent1: The project is steamrolling ahead, with everyone working efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The marathon runner was steamrolling towards the finish line with determination.
meanings.sent3: The toddler steamrolled through the toys in the playroom, leaving chaos behind.
meanings.sent4: The idea steamrolled through the company, gaining support from all departments.
meanings.sent5: The steamrolling train thundered down the tracks, unstoppable in its journey.
